captions.text:
OLDER ROSE (OFFSCREEN): Titanic,
it was called--

-I've got everything I need
right here with me.

I figure life's a gift, and I
don't intend on wasting it.

You never know what
hand you're going

You learn to take life
as it comes at you.

-When the ship docks, I'm
getting off with you.

[MUSIC - CELINE DION, "MY
HEART WILL GO ON"]
-Do not let go of my hand.

comments.author: marianna wolfe

comments.text:
Why do people not understand that Jack chose to give his life to Rose. I 
was talking to my dad because we just got done watching titanic and he 
says, "Lilly, your a titanic fan. Why didn't jack live?" I said back, "dad, 
people just don't understand Jack chose to sacrafise his self for her." So 
we went on and on about why Jack didn't stay alive. Jack wanted to save 
Rose. So he told her I'll be okay. But then her knew he would die. So, he 
wanted Rose to live. Because this is like a game of life or death. Jack 
chose death, for Rose. He watches over her. I believe jack and Rose were 
real.
comments.author: 77rgoss

comments.text:
James Cameron has stated that Jack HAD to die.
He was as a director was trying to send a message.
The majority of people in the real Titanic lost a loved one. So James C. 
wanted the public to feel the sadness of losing such a beloved character 
like Jack.

comments.author: Katie Thompstone

comments.text:
Clearly you did not watch that scene carefully. Jack did get on that piece 
of driftwood with Rose. Unfortunately, one of them had to get off because 
THERE WAS NOT ENOUGH BUOYANCY to keep both of them above water. Sure, they 
each could have taken turns, but the water was so horribly cold that it was 
nearly impossible for them to do it. So he only let her float on it so she 
can live, get married, and have children. And she did. Think before you 
type next time, will you?
